job description:
ABOUT BARK:

BARK is a company building products, experiences, and entertainment for dogs and the people who love them. The lasting brand that Disney has built for kids and families, BARK is building for the fast-growing market of dog people.

Our ambition-level is high, the opportunity is huge, and our love for dogs is through the roof! We launched in 2011 with BarkBox, a monthly themed subscription of all-natural treats and clever toys. Since then, we've shipped more than 50 million toys and treats to the dogs across the world and use all of that direct customer feedback to inform new initiatives and ways to make dogs happier.

But what kind of company is BARK? It's a company that has gone to the dogs. We are committed to a culture that is open, inclusive, generous, and enthusiastic just like our pups. United by this dog-obsession, we embrace diversity of all stripes and spots. If your camera roll is 90% pictures of your dog, you belong here.

At BARK, we know that dogs aren't pets; they're family. Our people crazy dog people believe that their dogs deserve the best. The best treats, the best toys, the best seat on the couch. Together, we're driven to be the people our dogs think we are.

WHO WE'RE SNIFFIN' FOR:

Can you give a pup belly scratches until you get carpal tunnel? Listen to squeaky toys until your ears bleed? We (and the worlds dogs) are looking for you. BARK is a fast-growing business for people who love, (*ruv) dogs. We're looking for a Data Analyst to join our team.

As a Data Analyst at BARK, you will be responsible for analyzing BARK's rich and varied data set. We have a diverse dataset that allows for deep insights into our business. You will be responsible for organizing, standardizing and analyzing our data to tell deeper stories about our business; where we've been and where we should go. We're looking for someone who is passionate about data, code and dogs!

RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Write high-quality, performant, accurate, readable SQL with respect for best practices
  • Advocate with product and engineering teams for collection of the *right* data
  • Define business metrics and KPIs
  • Design reports and dashboards to support business needs
  • Analyze data to uncover insights to help support and drive business decisions
  • Maintain a data dictionary that documents all data collected at Bark
  • Own data modeling in Looker
REQUIREMENTS
  • 3+ years' experience in a SQL-intensive role, ideally in a BI/Analytics or data engineering/data science function
  • Demonstrated attention to detail and commitment to reporting accuracy
  • Demonstrated ability to learn-by-doing
  • Experience with A/B testing
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Strong analytical skills
BONUS POINTS
  • Bachelor's degree preferably in math, economics, engineering, or related
  • Experience with Looker, web analytics, and Redshift
  • Experience with Python, R, Hive (Hadoop), Spark
  • Experience with ETLs
  • Demonstrated statistical analysis and machine learning skills
This position is a full-time, salaried position. It is located on-site at our office in Manhattan, New York. We offer health insurance for both you and your pup, 401k, wonderful team lunches, and a dog to pet anytime you wish.
